content.question:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 3 row table, with 6 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” the heading for row 2 is “h of x,” and the heading for row 3 is “h prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 2. h of x is 16. h prime of x is negative 10. Column 2. x is 6. h of x is negative 8. h prime of x is negative 2. Column 3. x is 7. h of x is negative 9. h prime of x is 0. Column 4. x is 9. h of x is negative 5. h prime of x is 4. Column 5. x is 11. h of x is 7. h prime of x is 8. Column 6. x is 13. h of x is 8. h prime of x is 12. " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>13</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>16</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>27</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>12</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
Selected values of the differentiable function <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its first derivative <math alttext="h prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the integral from, 0 to x, of, h of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. What is the least possible number of critical points for <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="2 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 13" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>13</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: It cannot be determined from the information given.

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
